alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 3:08PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL HOT SPRINGS AND NORTHWESTERN FREMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 308 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dubois, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Hot Springs and northwestern Fremont Counties, including the following locations... Dubois Municipal Airport and Double Cabin Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East
